intro: Astragalus pauperculus, commonly known as the poor man's milkvetch, is a small, herbaceous perennial native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its upright stems and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. It is adapted to harsh environments, featuring deep roots and a low-growing habit to conserve water and withstand extreme temperatures.
